title: A pen and coloured ink Christmas card for 1944, depicting a Changi inmate at a camp fire

  title_text: A pen and coloured ink Christmas card for 1944
 depicting a Changi inmate at a camp fire

  preference: main

  creation_date: 1941-1945

  creation_place_original_location: Singapore

  inscriptions: 

  inscription_language: 

  shape: irregular

  materials_name: paper (fiber product) ink

  techniques_name: drawing (image-making)

  object_colour: multicolored

  physical_appearance: This is a christmas card. It is drawn on a gray pain paper in multicolored ink. The flap at the top features drawn mistletoe and written greetings. The picture at the bottom is ofa man
 dressed in shorts
 cooking over a fire. There is a small fold at the top right of the card. There are no tears seen.

  sgcool_label_text: This pen and coloured ink Christmas card is from 1944. It depicts a Changi inmate at a camp fire. The card illustrates P.O.Ws’ efforts in maintaining their spirits and traditions in spite of the conditions they lived in. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

The picture at the bottom is ofa man, dressed in shorts, cooking over a fire. There is a small fold at the top right of the card. There are no tears seen.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This pen and coloured ink Christmas card is from 1944. It depicts a Changi inmate at a camp fire. The card illustrates P.O.Ws’ efforts in maintaining their spirits and traditions in spite of the conditions they lived in. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
